channel.title: Money raising idea's?
channel.description:
Well as some know, i have to raise £3395 for an expidition trip to costa rica in 2008. We stay there for a month and do things like, help build their schools, paint churches, visiting some of the orphaned children, hiking some of the mountains, and i think some time going through jungles.
So, has anyone any ideas on how i can raise some money :). Were already doing a few, such as doing the year 11 prom, that money's split between the team which currently consists of 30 people. So making £300 from a prom is only £10 ea :p.
So, yup, any ideas at all?

item.title: Money raising idea's?
item.dc:creator: @Portal Portal
item.description:
@Portal wrote:

lol so funny Im not being rude at all geno but I saw your post and I just KNEW that that was coming.

Good luck with the fund raising though Taios. Id suggest making a support my cause website with a small donation page. Describe what you will be doing there and hopefully people will allow you to advertise if they believe your cause is worthy. Even if it only gains you a few dollars, its a few less dollars you have to gather for the trip.

item.title: Money raising idea's?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Sounds like it’s kind of hard. =\ When we had shave for a cure a few years ago at my school, I went in it. Basically, I went around with a letter type thing and asked for donations. That, or you could do a fundraiser, and actually have companies pledge stuff for prizes. Or just get them to pledge cash which can go straight towards your trip. You’d be surprised how quick it can add up if you get businesses to pledge $10/10 pound amounts. If you do something like this, it might be wise to get a letter from your principal/headmaster saying that it’s real etc.

Hopefully that can help - Since you can’t work, there’s not much else you can do.

Read full topic
